body:
Note that we're still using --benchmark_min_time=0 for tests (I have a PR
to correct that)

On Thu, Nov 2, 2017 at 3:16 PM Noah Eisen <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Trying to fix #13053 <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/13053>. Still not
> sure why this works for bm_diff, but not for tests runs
>
> This reverts commit ac5522b
> <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/commit/ac5522bef7755089f631802aa213259e1d6f74df>
> .
> ------------------------------
> You can view, comment on, or merge this pull request online at:
>
>   https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/13244
> Commit Summary
>
>    - Revert "Revert "Fix benchmark crash""
>
> File Changes
>
>    - *M* test/cpp/microbenchmarks/fullstack_streaming_ping_pong.h
>    <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/13244/files#diff-0> (47)
>
> Patch Links:
>
>    - https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/13244.patch
>    - https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/13244.diff
>
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/13244>, or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AJpudeASDcrmwccYk68W9vbtzTDTY6Hbks5syj8sgaJpZM4QQa5E>
> .
>
benchmark_min_time=0 should make the test complete instantly right? Which is surprising because this was causing timeouts on kokoro

expect_tags was uninitialized.

Basic C++ Dbg #13270
Basic C++ Opt #13148 #13269
Tsan #13178
